description:
'Move fast and break things' left its place to 'Move fast with stable performance' once the organisations started having a high quality threshold while innovating.

I will be talking about my experience in big tech, building complex distributed systems, how we rapidly experimented and built high scale MVPs/products while keeping resiliency and performance at a high level.


People would be able to find points that they can apply to their day-to-day jobs:

  • How to plan their next big software challenge in order to build fast maintaining high quality
  • Performance trade-offs to consider
  • Battle-proven techniques to build more resilient systems
  • How to adopt systems thinking on our day-to-day as a team
title: Move fast without breaking things
